autodse.explorer.algorithm¶

The main module of search algorithm.

class autodse.explorer.algorithm.SearchAlgorithm(ds: Dict[str, autodse.parameter.DesignParameter], log_file_name: str = 'algo.log')¶

Base class of search algorithms.

The base serach algorithm includes a set of functions to manipulate design points and another set of function propotypes for search algorithms to implement.

ds¶

Design space.

log¶

The logger.

static clone_point(point: Dict[str, Union[str, int]]) → Dict[str, Union[str, int]]¶

Clone the given design point.

Parameters

point -- The design point to be cloned.

Returns

A cloned design point with same values.

gen() → Generator[[List[Dict[str, Union[str, int]]], Optional[Dict[str, autodse.result.Result]]], None]¶

The main generator function of search algorithm.

Returns

A generator that keeps producing design points for exploration.

gen_options(point: Dict[str, Union[str, int]], pid: str) → List[Union[int, str]]¶

Evaluate available options of the target design parameter.

Parameters

  • point -- The current design point.

  • pid -- The target design parameter ID.

Returns

A list of available options.

get_order(point: Dict[str, Union[str, int]], pid: str) → int¶

Evaluate the order of the current value.

Parameters

  • point -- The current design point.

  • pid -- The target design parameter ID.

Returns

The order.

move_by(point: Dict[str, Union[str, int]], pid: str, step: int = 1) → int¶

Move N steps of pid parameter's value in a design point in place.

Parameters

  • point -- The design point to be manipulated.

  • pid -- The target design parameter.

  • step -- The steps to move. Note that step can be positive or negatie, but we will not move cirulatory even the step is too large.

Returns

The actual move steps.

update_child(point: Dict[str, Union[str, int]], pid: str) → None¶

Check values of affect parameters and update them in place if it is invalid.

Parameters

  • point -- The current design point.

  • pid -- The design parameter ID that just be changed.

validate_value(point: Dict[str, Union[str, int]], pid: str) → bool¶

Check if the current value is valid and set it to the closest value if not.

Parameters

  • point -- The current design point.

  • pid -- The design parameter ID that just be changed.

Returns

True if the value is changed.
